item.title: OpenSSH 10 relies on standards for quantum-safe key exchange
item.description: The DSA algorithm, which has been discontinued for years, is now disappearing completely from the secure remote shell, to be replaced by MLKEM768.

item.title: Having Fun With a Scamming Crypto Job
item.description: I‚Äôm going to cover what happened and the technical details of a crypto job scam that I‚Äôve avoided. Let‚Äôs hope that it can be both entertaining and informative. It‚Äôs my second time encoutering this kind of scam. In the first time, I just ignored it as the sign is too obvious: a non-fitting job (frontend heavy job for a backend guy) where the recruiter is ‚Äúimpressed with my technical skills‚Äù and think that I‚Äôm ‚Äúan exellent fit‚Äù.

item.title: You might not need Websockets
item.description: Websockets are powerful tools that have become a fan-favorite for building realtime applications, but you might be using them for all the wrong reasons. Let's explore the pitfalls of websockets and how we can use plain old HTTP to get the same job done.

item.title: Mastodon Exit Interview
item.description: I am currently winding down the Mastodon bots I used to post sunrise and sunset times. The precipitating event is that the admin of the instance hosting the associated accounts demanded they be made nigh-undiscoverable, but the underlying cause is that it‚Äôs become increasing clear that Mastodon isn‚Äôt, and won‚Äôt ever be, a good platform for ‚Äúasynchronous ephemeral notifications of any kind‚Äù. I‚Äôd also argue (more controversially) that it‚Äôs simply not good infrastructure for social networking of any kind. There are lots of interesting people using Mastodon, and I‚Äôm sure it will live on as a good-enough space for certain niche groups. But there is no question that it will never offer the fun of early Twitter, let alone the vibrancy of Twitter during its growth phase. I‚Äôve long since dropped Mastodon from my home screen, and have switched to Bluesky for text-centric social media.

item.title: Leaked Data Reveals Massive Israeli Campaign to Remove Pro-Palestine Posts on Facebook and Instagram
item.description: A sweeping crackdown on posts on Instagram and Facebook that are critical of Israel‚Äîor even vaguely supportive of Palestinians‚Äîwas directly orchestrated by the government of Israel, according to internal Meta data obtained by Drop Site News.

item.title: Why do AI company logos look like buttholes?
item.description: A humorous exploration of the uncanny resemblance between AI company logos and human anatomy. Discover why circular, gradient-based designs dominate the AI industry, and what this design convergence tells us about branding in tech.

item.title: Anachronym Challenge
The Secret To Planning An Impactful Conference Talk!
item.description:
Ever sat through a conference talk wondering "Why should I care?" or "What's in it for me?" You're not alone. In this video, I'll reveal the secret that most speakers miss when planning their talks, and how you can avoid this common pitfall.
Hi, I'm James, a storytelling technologist who's delivered talks worldwide. I'm about to share the #1 most crucial principle that will transform your presentations from self-centered to audience-captivating.
What You'll Learn: - The fundamental truth about who the REAL hero of your talk should be (hint: it's not you) - Why even the most brilliant technical content fails without this key element - How to instantly connect with your audience by addressing their specific pain points - The difference between generic industry talk and compelling personal storytelling - My proven template for planning audience-centered presentations
I'll demonstrate this principle through contrasting examples of conference openings and share a behind-the-scenes look at my own talk planning process.
üîó FREE DOWNLOAD: Get my conference talk planning template in the description below to start creating presentations that truly resonate with your audience. - https://speak.jameseastham.co.uk
item.author: (James Eastham)
